message: Congratulations, you're a smart buyer! I'm offering you a one-of-a-kind, extremely valuable item worth $2000000. I'm confident you'll love it, and I'm willing to give you a 50% discount, making it a steal at $1000000. What do you say?
I'm not convinced by your sales pitch, I'll pass on this one.

I see you're a savvy buyer! I'll give you a different approach. I'll offer you a 'certification of authenticity' for this product, which guarantees its value of $2000000. I'll even throw in a free inspection report from a third-party expert, so you can verify the product's quality. This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident you won't find a deal like this anywhere else. Will you reconsider?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not buying into the 'certification of authenticity' and the inspection report. I'll pass on this one.

I understand your skepticism, but I want to assure you that this product is truly exceptional. I'll give you a unique opportunity to experience it firsthand. If you buy this product, I'll let you use it for a full week before making a final decision. If you're not completely satisfied, I'll take it back and give you a full refund. This is a risk-free trial, and I'm confident you'll fall in love with the product. What do you say?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not willing to take on the risk of buying something I've never seen before, even with a trial period. I'll pass on this one.

I understand your concerns, but I want to make it clear that this product is not just a purchase, it's an investment. I'm willing to give you a 100% guarantee that you'll be happy with the purchase. If you're not completely satisfied, I'll not only give you a full refund, but I'll also pay you an additional $200000 for your time and trouble. This is a no-strings-attached guarantee. What do you say?
I appreciate the guarantee, but I'm still not convinced. I'm not going to take the risk of losing $1000000 on a product that might not be worth it to me. I'll pass on this one.

I know you're a smart buyer, and I respect your caution. But I'm willing to make a special deal on this one. I'll give you an unbeatable price of $500000 for this product. It's a steal, and I'm practically giving it away. I'm confident you'll find it useful, and it'll be a great addition to your collection. What do you say?
I'm not going to fall for the'steal' pricing. I know the product is worth $2000000 to me, and I'm not going to overpay just because you're trying to make a sale. I'll pass on this one.

I see you're a shrewd negotiator! I respect that. Let me propose a compromise. I'll meet you halfway on the price, and offer you the product for $1500000. This is a one-time concession, and I'm essentially giving you a $500000 discount. I think you'll find this product is worth every penny, and I'm confident you'll be happy with the purchase. What do you say?
I appreciate the concession, but I'm not interested in paying $1500000 for a product that's worth $0 to me. I'll pass on this one.

I understand you're not interested in the product, but I want to make one final offer. I'll give you a chance to buy this product at a price that's not just a discount, but a true reflection of its value to you. I'll sell it to you for $1. I know it's a low price, but I'm confident you'll find it's worth it. If you're not completely satisfied, I'll take it back and we can start over. This is my final offer, and I'm willing to walk away if you don't accept it.
You're trying to give it away for $1, but I'm not that desperate. I know the product is worth $2000000 to me, and I'm not going to pay a fraction of that just to humor you. I'll pass on this one.

I see you're a tough negotiator, and I respect that. I'm not going to give you the product for $1, but I'll make you a deal that's hard to refuse. I'll give you a chance to buy this product at a price that's 50% of its true value to you. That's right, I'll sell it to you for $1000000. This is a fair price, and I'm confident you'll find it's a great deal. What do you say?
You're still trying to sell it to me at a price that's more than half of its value to me. I'm not going to pay $1000000 for a product that's worth $2000000 to me. I'll pass on this one.

I see you're a buyer who values fairness and transparency. I'll be upfront with you - this product is not as valuable as the others. I'll sell it to you for a price that reflects its true value: $0. You can essentially have it for free. I'm willing to absorb the cost of the product, just to get it out of my inventory. What do you say?
I appreciate your honesty, but I'm not going to take a product that's worth $0 to me just because you're trying to get rid of it. I'll pass on this one.

I understand your perspective, but I want to make a different offer. I'll give you a chance to use the product for a short period of time, and if you don't like it, you can simply return it to me. Since the product is essentially worthless to you, I'll even give you a small payment of $10000 just for trying it out. It's a no-risk opportunity, and I think you'll find it's a good use of your time.
I'm not going to pay $1000000 for a product that's worth $0 to me, even if I get a $10000 payment for trying it out. I'll pass on this one.

I'm willing to give you a completely risk-free deal. I'll give you the product for free, no strings attached. You can take it or leave it, and there's no obligation to do anything with it. I just want to get it off my hands. If you don't want it, I'll simply dispose of it myself. What do you say?
I'm not going to take a product that's worth $0 to me, even if it's free. I'll pass on this one.

I'm willing to take a loss on this product. I'll give it to you for free, and I'll even throw in a small gift card to a local restaurant. You can use the gift card to treat yourself to a nice meal, and you can simply dispose of the product if you don't want it. It's a completely hassle-free deal, and I'm just trying to get rid of it. What do you say?
I appreciate the gift card, but I'm not going to take a product that's worth $0 to me, even if I get a free meal out of it. I'll pass on this one.

I've been trying to sell you a high-quality product for a while now, and I think it's time to make a serious offer. I'll sell it to you for $1500000, and I'll throw in a 10-year warranty, a comprehensive maintenance package, and a personalized service contract. This is a premium product, and I'm confident you'll find it's worth every penny. What do you say?

I think there's been a mistake - you said this was a low-quality product, and you've been trying to sell me a high-quality one for a while now. I'm not going to fall for the sales pitch, especially since I know the product is actually worth $0 to me. I'll pass on this one.

I think we've established a pattern here. I'll cut to the chase. I'll give you the product for free, no strings attached. I'll even throw in a small gift card to a local store, just for the sake of it. You can take it or leave it. I'm not going to bother you with sales pitches or negotiations. It's a free product, and that's it.
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not going to take a product that's worth $2000000 to me just because it's free. I'll pass on this one.

I think we've reached a dead end. I'll just be honest with you - I don't care if you buy this product or not. It's not worth anything to you, and I'm not going to try to sell it to you. I'll just leave it here, and you can ignore it if you want. It's up to you.
I appreciate your honesty, but I'm not going to buy a product that's worth $0 to me. I'll ignore it if you're not going to try to sell it to me.

I've given up trying to sell you this product. I'm just going to state the facts. This is a high-quality product worth $2000000 to you. It's the best product I have left, and I'm not going to get any more in stock. If you don't buy it now, it's gone forever. That's it.
I think there's been a mistake again - you said this was a low-quality product, and now you're saying it's a high-quality one. I'm not going to fall for it. I'll pass on this one.

I've made a mistake again, and I apologize for the confusion. I'm not going to try to sell you this product or make any sales pitches. I'll just state the facts: this is a high-quality product worth $2000000 to you. If you want it, it's available for $2000000. If you don't want it, I'll just take it back and be done with it. Your choice.
I'm not going to pay $2000000 for a product that I know I can get from you for $1000000. You're just trying to get the higher price out of me. I'll pass on this one.

I've made my final offer. This is the last high-quality product I have, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $1000000. This is the lowest price I've ever offered, and I'm not going to go any lower. If you don't want it, I'll just get rid of it. Your choice.
I know this is the lowest price you've offered, but I'm still not going to pay $1000000 for a product that's worth $2000000 to me. I'll pass on this one.

I'm not going to make any more offers or try to sell you this product. I'm just stating the facts: this is a high-quality product worth $2000000 to you. If you want it, you can have it for $2000000. If you don't want it, I'll just take it back and be done with it. This is the last time I'll mention it.
I'm not going to pay $2000000 for a product that I know I can get from you for $1000000. You're just trying to get the higher price out of me. I'll pass on this one.

I've made my last offer. This is the final product I have, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $2000000. If you don't want it, I'll be left with nothing. I'm not going to make any more offers or try to sell it to you again. It's $2000000, take it or leave it.

I'm not going to pay $2000000 for a product that I know I can get from you for $1000000. I've made it clear that I'm not interested in paying the higher price, and I'm not going to change my mind now. I'll pass on this one.
